intro: Hieracium mattiroloanum subsp. mattiroloanum, commonly known as the Mattiroloanum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. This subspecies is noted for its limited distribution and is considered a rare plant in its native range.
